title: Add the "attestation simulator" performance metric
body:
## Description

I think it would be interesting if the BN would "pretend" to create an attestation every slot and then look at how that attestation would have performed.

In detail, I think we should call [`BeaconChain::produce_unaggregated_attestation`](https://github.com/sigp/lighthouse/blob/dfcb3363c757671eb19d5f8e519b4b94ac74677a/beacon_node/beacon_chain/src/beacon_chain.rs#L1557-L1561) 4s into each slot and store the resulting `attestation.data`. Then, in `ValidatorMonitor::process_valid_state` we could see if the `attestation.data` matches the head/target/source.

Some things to consider:

- If we use the `ValidatorMonitor` then it'll only run when the user has the validator monitor enabled. That seems reasonable to me.
- We probably want to only check the head/target/source once the `state.slot` is some slots beyond `attestation.data.slot` to defend against re-orgs. I'd suggest 16 slots as a trade-off between being safe enough and fast enough. I'm open to suggestion though!

## Extra Info

### Attestation reward details

When I talk about "matching the head/target/source" I'm talking about whether the attestation meets the requirements to be given rewards. The [Altair specs](https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/dev/specs/altair/beacon-chain.md#participation-flag-indices) define the "Participation Flag Indices". If a validator has one of those flags set, then they receive rewards. You can see them getting set in [`get_attestation_participation_flag_indices`](https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/dev/specs/altair/beacon-chain.md#get_attestation_participation_flag_indices).

### Timer example

Here's an example of a task on the `BeaconChain` that runs periodically each slot:

https://github.com/sigp/lighthouse/blob/dfcb3363c757671eb19d5f8e519b4b94ac74677a/beacon_node/beacon_chain/src/proposer_prep_service.rs#L27-L72
